data.title: Remove & sort usings
data.body: Just ran some auto-format on everything. Sorry for the big-ass diff.

data.title: Transforms: IntoActor: does not like uppercase characters
data.body:
```
HACKY Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20140602
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18033
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.ReadOnlyDictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Transforms..ctor(Actor self, TransformsInfo info)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.TransformsInfo.Create(ActorInitializer init)
   at OpenRA.Actor..ctor(World world, String name, TypeDictionary initDict)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.SpawnMPUnits.SpawnUnitsForPlayer(World w, Player p, CPos sp)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.SpawnMPUnits.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey61.<>m__E1()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Not sure if this is intentional or not, but specifying the IntoActor on the Transforms trait using any uppercase in the actor name causes the above mentioned crash.

EDIT: Apologies, seems to be a duplicate of #4124. Should have checked more thoroughly.

data.title: Add ability to control multiple players
data.body:
This would be helpful to test things. So add like an ai player which can also be controlled.

data.title: Empty filter in server list doesn't work
data.body: There is no way to only see empty servers. To see them also waiting check box has to be ticked.

data.title: TD, cannot build concrete walls at locations where sandbags were recently destroyed
data.body: If sandbags are destroyed (in my case by an airstrike), I cannot build concrete walls on the tiles where they once occupied. To clear the problem, I need to sell the "invisible" sandbags first, then I'm able to build at those locations.

data.title: Shift+Number deselects unit
data.body:
When I have a control group and I want to add another unit to that, shift+group number deselects the unit. This doesn't happen always but still often.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2680565-shift-number-deselects-unit?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Replayviewer slows down
data.body: When I watch a replay in fast forward mode, after a while it slows down below normal play speed. I have to pause it and wait a bit before it can play fast again. When it slows down, it already is in fast forward mode, when i click >> it shows max speed text.

data.title: Planes outside map borders cannot be controlled
data.body: This is annoying. Is this a regression of #5627? Also helicopters that were pushed outside map by other helicopters are lost. They are there but cannot be controlled.

data.title: minimap-tags for cloned maps / maps with different rules
Made the Mono.NAT integration more robust
data.body: This adds the suggestions made in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5466 to our codebase. Tested with my Fritz!Box.

data.title: selecting a specific replay causing a crash
News.yaml in cache caused: System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException
data.body:
```
HACKY Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20140602
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18449
Exception of type `System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException`: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
Inner Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
     at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.MainMenuLogic.<ReadNews>m__268(MiniYamlNode node)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectListIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.MainMenuLogic.DisplayNews(IEnumerable`1 newsItems)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.MainMenuLogic..ctor(Widget widget, World world)
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeConstructorInfo.Invoke(BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateUsingArgs(ConstructorInfo ctor, Dictionary`2 args)
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[T](String className, Dictionary`2 args)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.PostInit(WidgetArgs args)
   at OpenRA.WidgetLoader.LoadWidget(WidgetArgs args, Widget parent, MiniYamlNode node)
   at OpenRA.WidgetLoader.LoadWidget(WidgetArgs args, Widget parent, String w)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadWidget(World world, String id, Widget parent, WidgetArgs args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.LoadWidgetAtGameStart.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.DefaultLoadScreen.TestAndContinue()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.DefaultLoadScreen.StartGame()
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeWithMod(String mod, String replay)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.ModBrowserLogic.<LoadMod>c__AnonStorey1B4.<>m__4BA()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Primitives.ActionQueue.PerformActions()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Was caused by a news.yaml file that had nothing in it except "NUL" See:
http://postimg.org/image/r7qgzhntv/

Deleting the news.yaml from the Documents\OpenRA\Cache\HackyRA fixed the crash.

No idea why an empty news.yaml occurred.

data.title: Polished the Replay Browser dropdowns
data.body: as complaint in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5641.

data.title: Added ./update-wiki.sh to Travis CI deployment
data.body: As described in #5643 I simply forgot it. There probably have to be no encrypted Tokens or credentials as the wiki has public commit access. The build server was allowed to do so with just this script and his anonymous non-GitHub account.

data.title: update-wiki.sh isn't run (or fails?) on Travis.
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/New-Lua-API was last updated for playtest-20140602, which was the final playtest packaged on the old build server.  The new travis-built releases haven't updated the wiki.

data.title: Implement IMA ADPCM WAV file support
data.body:
Fixes #4628. Tested with mono and stereo files.

I'm not particularly happy with the dependency on AudLoader - perhaps the ADPCM decoding should be moved to a new support class instead.

data.title: Replay viewer, dropdown box goes out of screen
data.body:
While trying to search a player with the handy new search features I noticed the dropdown box goes out of screen and is not going into 'scroll' mode.

![openradropdown](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5729926/3281181/e5faab18-f49a-11e3-8efe-d0883bb4533b.png)

Using latest release

data.title: Separated Tick and TickRender more cleanly
data.body: This is important for the in-game map editor to look good while the game is force paused. It also adds consistency to the way the project as a whole is structured. This is separated from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 for easier reviewing. The make animation activity to trait refactor is not done for fun, but to fix severe breakage. As a side effect this may counter glitches when pausing the game like a chronosphere effect looping forever.

data.title: Fixed some minor StyleCop issues
data.body: Sometimes I have to look at code for quite a long time and when the bad formatting becomes unbearable I edit it although nothing around it changes. They also happen occasionally when I try things and revert, but keep the cleanup. This is split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 as I already sorted them into a separate commit to keep things clean.

data.title: Restore the blinking ready text in TD.
Change the TD alternate ready colour to yellow.
data.body: The green doesn't fit the mod theme at all.

data.title: TraitDictionary cleanup
data.body:
Little bit of housekeeping for TraitDictionary in the first commit. Nothing worth calling out.

I discovered the All and GetMultiple methods for TraitContainer were being called enough to make a hand-rolled enumerator somewhat worthwhile.

For All, I saw CPU spent in enumeration drop by half from 1.90% to 0.94% of overall CPU time (measured on the RA shellmap for 30 seconds or so), and a more modest 1.25% to 1.00% change for GetMultiple. Not sure it's worth the extra code though so I'll let you chaps decide on that one.

data.title: Allow support powers to require tech prerequisites.
data.body:
Rewritten version of #5374.  This allows us to specify multiple prerequisites for a support power, and is the first step towards moving the shared powers onto the player actor (simplifying the code and making it consistent with production).

Two simple testcases:
- Add `Prerequisites: dome` to `MSLO -> NukePower` in RA for a nuke that also requires radar to charge.
- Move `HQ -> AirstrikePower` to `player` in TD for shared powers.

data.title: Some R# refactoring
Cannot leave active Workspace once OpenRA starts
data.body:
Once OpenRA starts, its window focus over-rides everything on a desktop so it is impossible to change to another Workspace; attempting to do so just returns to the OpenRA window

ArchLinux XFCE 
OpenRA release 20140608

data.title: Add "/all" dev command
data.body:
It will issue all the available commands.

The last commit will make the dev commands always available on single player games, regardless of the "AllowCheats" setting.

data.title: Move map helpers from WorldUtils to Map
data.body: Moves a bunch of map-related helper methods from WorldUtils.cs to Map.cs.

data.title: Introduce CellLayer and CellRegion abstractions.
data.body:
The next step towards TS/RA2 tileset support (#5350) is to remove the assumption that map coordinates == cell coordinates (the isometric games have cell axes rotated by 45 degrees to the map).

The existing code required each trait that stored something for each cell to roll its own storage, usually via an inefficient 2D array.  The CellLayer class replaces this duplication with a wrapper around a 1D array, and which can transparently convert between cell and map coordinates (see [pchote:isometric](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/isometric) for a sneak-peek at where this is going).

The next problem is enumerating over a set of cells on the screen / in the map / etc.  Looping over the x and y axes won't work, as they are rotated relative to the screen for isometric maps.  The CellRegion class introduces a simpler way of enumerating regions that will work for both perspectives.
